member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.IAudioEncoder.GetMaxEncodedLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of bytes in encoded data for a given number of source bytes.
member.param: Number of source bytes. Specify 0 for a flush buffer size.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.IAudioEncoder.EncodeBlock(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.param: Number of bytes to read from .
member.returns: The number of bytes written to .

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.IAudioEncoder.Flush(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Flushes internal encoder buffers if any.
member.returns: The number of bytes written to .

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame
member.summary: Mpeg Layer 3 (MP3) audio encoder using the LAME codec in external DLL.
member.remarks: The class is designed for using only a single instance at a time. Find information about and downloads of the LAME project at http://lame.sourceforge.net/

member.name: F:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.SupportedBitRates
member.summary: Supported output bit rates (in kilobits per second).
member.remarks: Currently supported are 64, 96, 128, 160, 192 and 320 kbps.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.SetLameDllLocation(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the location of LAME DLL for using by this class.
member.remarks: This method may be called before creating any instances of this class. The LAME DLL should have the appropriate bitness (32/64), depending on the current process. If it is not already loaded into the process, the method loads it automatically.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: Output bit rate (in kilobits per second).
member.remarks: Encoder expects audio data in 16-bit samples. Stereo data should be interleaved: left sample first, right sample second.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.GetMaxEncodedLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets maximum length of encoded data.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.BitsPerSample
member.summary: Bits per sample per single channel.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.ILameFacade
member.summary: Interface is used to access the API of the LAME DLL.
member.remarks: Clients of class need not to work with this interface directly.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.ILameFacade.InputSampleRate
member.summary: Sample rate of source audio data.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mp3AudioEncoderLame.ILameFacade.Encode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a chunk of audio data.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Codecs.SingleThreadedVideoEncoderWrapper
member.summary: Ensures that all access to the enclosed instance is made on a single thread.

remarks.para: Especially useful for unmanaged encoders like in multi-threaded scenarios like asynchronous encoding.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.SingleThreadedVideoEncoderWrapper.#ctor(System.Func{SharpAvi.Codecs.IVideoEncoder})
member.param: Factory for creating an encoder instance. It will be invoked on the same thread as all subsequent operations of the interface.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.SingleThreadedVideoEncoderWrapper.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the enclosed encoder and stops the internal thread.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.SingleThreadedVideoEncoderWrapper.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits per pixel in encoded image.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.SingleThreadedVideoEncoderWrapper.MaxEncodedSize
member.summary: Determines the amount of space needed in the destination buffer for storing the encoded data of a single frame.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.IVideoEncoder.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits per pixel in encoded image.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.IVideoEncoder.MaxEncodedSize
member.summary: Determines the amount of space needed in the destination buffer for storing the encoded data of a single frame.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.IVideoEncoder.EncodeFrame(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.param: Frame bitmap data. The expected bitmap format is BGR32 top-to-bottom. Alpha component is not used.
Start offset of the frame data in the . Expected length of the data is determined by the parameters specified when instantinating the encoder.
Buffer for storing the encoded frame data.
Start offset of the encoded data in the buffer. There should be enough space till the end of the buffer, see .
When the method returns, contains the value indicating whether this frame was encoded as a key frame.
member.returns: The actual number of bytes written to the buffer.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Codecs.MotionJpegVideoEncoderWpf
member.summary: Encodes frames in Motion JPEG format.

remarks.para: Note for .NET 3.5: This encoder is designed for single-threaded use. If you use it in multi-threaded scenarios (like asynchronous calls), then consider wrapping it in .

This encoder is not fully conformant to the Motion JPEG standard, as each encoded frame is a full JPEG picture with its own Huffman tables, and not those fixed Huffman tables defined by the Motion JPEG standard. However, (at least most) modern decoders for Motion JPEG properly handle this situation. This also produces a little overhead on the file size.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.MotionJpegVideoEncoderWpf.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: Compression quality in the range [1..100]. Less values mean less size and lower image quality.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.MotionJpegVideoEncoderWpf.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits per pixel in encoded image.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm
member.summary: Encodes video stream in MPEG-4 format using one of VCM codecs installed on the system.

remarks.para: Supported codecs include Microsoft MPEG-4 V3 and V2, Xvid, DivX and x264vfw. The codec to be used is selected from the ones installed on the system. The encoder can be forced to use MPEG-4 codecs that are not explicitly supported. However, in this case it is not guaranteed to work properly.

For x264vfw codec, it is recommended to enable Zero Latency option in its settings. 64-bit support is limited, as there are no 64-bit versions of Microsoft and DivX codecs, and Xvid can produce some errors.
In multi-threaded scenarios, like asynchronous encoding, it is recommended to wrap this encoder into for the stable work.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm.DefaultCodecPreference
member.summary: Default preferred order of the supported codecs.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm.GetAvailableCodecs
member.summary: Gets info about the supported codecs that are installed on the system.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpAvi.FourCC[])
member.param: Number of frames to be encoded. If not known, specify 0.
Compression quality in the range [1..100]. Less values mean less size and lower image quality.
List of codecs that can be used by this encoder, in preferred order.
member.exception: No compatible codec was found in the system.

remarks.para: It is not guaranteed that the codec will respect the specified value. This depends on its implementation.
If no preferred codecs are specified, then is used. MPEG-4 codecs that are not explicitly supported can be specified. However, in this case the encoder is not guaranteed to work properly.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm.Finalize
member.summary: Performs any necessary cleanup before this instance is garbage-collected.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits per pixel in the encoded image.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm.MaxEncodedSize
member.summary: Maximum size of the encoded frame.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Codecs.Mpeg4VideoEncoderVcm.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all unmanaged resources used by the encoder.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Codecs.VfwApi
member.summary: Selected constants, structures and functions from Video for Windows APIs.
member.remarks: Useful for implementing stream encoding using VCM codecs. See Windows API documentation on the meaning and usage of all this stuff.

member.name: F:SharpAvi.Codecs.VfwApi.CompressFramesInfo.KeyRate
member.remarks: Equal to 1 if each frame is a key frame.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Codecs.UncompressedVideoEncoder
member.summary: Encodes frames in BGR24 format without compression.
member.remarks: The main purpose of this encoder is to flip bitmap vertically (from top-down to bottom-up) and to convert pixel format to 24 bits.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Codecs.UncompressedVideoEncoder.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits per pixel in encoded image.

member.summary: Splits frame rate value to integer rate and scale values used in some AVI headers and VfW APIs.
member.param: Frame rate. Rounded to 3 fractional digits.
When the method returns, contains rate value.
When the method returns, contains scale value.

member.summary: Adds asynchronous writes support for underlying stream.

member.remarks: Simply delegates all operations to wrapped stream.

member.summary: Serializes synchronous and asynchronous invocations in one queue.

member.remarks: Waits for any previously scheduled invocations to complete.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.SequentialInvoker.InvokeAsync(System.Action)
member.remarks: This action will be invoked after all previously scheduled invocations complete.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.SequentialInvoker.WaitForPendingInvocations
member.summary: Waits for currently pending invocations to complete.
member.remarks: New invocations, which are possibly scheduled during this call, are not considered.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviStreamBase.PrepareForWriting
member.remarks: Default implementation freezes properties of the stream (further modifications are not allowed).

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviStreamBase.FinishWriting
member.summary: Performs actions before closing the stream.
member.remarks: Default implementation does nothing.

member.summary: Wrapper on the object to provide encoding.

member.summary: Sample rate, in samples per second (herz).

member.summary: Number of bits per sample per single channel (usually 8 or 16).

member.remarks: The formats are defined in mmreg.h from Windows SDK. Some of the well-known formats are listed in the class.

member.summary: Average byte rate of the stream.

member.remarks: Contains data of specific structure like MPEGLAYER3WAVEFORMAT that follow common WAVEFORMATEX field.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviAudioStream.WriteBlock(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a block of audio data.
member.remarks: Division of audio data into blocks may be arbitrary. However, it is reasonable to write blocks of approximately the same duration as a single video frame.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviAudioStream.WriteBlockAsync(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes a block of audio data.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous write operation.
member.remarks: Division of audio data into blocks may be arbitrary. However, it is reasonable to write blocks of approximately the same duration as a single video frame. The contents of should not be modified until this write operation ends.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStreamInternal
member.summary: Interface of streams used for internal workings of .

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStreamInternal.PrepareForWriting
member.remarks: Called by when writing starts. More exactly, on the first call to the Write method of any stream, before any data is actually written.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStreamInternal.FinishWriting
member.remarks: Called by just before it closes (if writing had started). Allows to write a final data to the stream. This is not appropriate place for freeing resources, better to implement . All streams are disposed on disposing of even if writing had not yet started.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStreamInternal.WriteHeader
member.summary: Called to delegate writing of the stream header to a proper overload of IAviStreamWriteHandler.WriteStreamHeader.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStreamInternal.WriteFormat
member.summary: Called to delegate writing of the stream format to a proper overload of IAviStreamWriteHandler.WriteStreamFormat.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Output.IAviVideoStream
member.remarks: After the first invocation of no properties of the stream can be changed.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Output.IAviVideoStream.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Number of bits per pixel in the frame's image.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Output.IAviVideoStream.Codec
member.summary: ID of the codec used to encode the stream contents.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviVideoStream.WriteFrame(System.Boolean,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a frame to the stream.
member.param: Is this frame a key frame?
Index of the first byte of the frame data.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.IAviVideoStream.WriteFrameAsync(System.Boolean,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Asynchronously writes a frame to the stream.
member.param: Is this frame a key frame?
Index of the first byte of the frame data.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.
member.remarks: The contents of should not be modified until this write operation ends.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStreamWriteHandler
member.summary: Interface of an object performing actual writing for the streams.

member.name: T:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter
member.summary: Used to write an AVI file.
member.remarks: After writing begin to any of the streams, no property changes or stream addition are allowed.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of for writing to a file.
member.param: Path to an AVI file being written.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of for writing to a stream.
member.param: Whether to leave the stream open when closing .

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.FramesPerSecond
member.remarks: The value of the property is rounded to 3 fractional digits. Default value is 1.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.EmitIndex1
member.summary: Whether to emit index used in AVI v1 format.
member.remarks: By default, only index conformant to OpenDML AVI extensions (AVI v2) is emitted. Presence of v1 index may improve the compatibility of generated AVI files with certain software, especially when there are multiple streams.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.Streams
member.summary: AVI streams that have been added so far.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.AddVideoStream(System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpAvi.BitsPerPixel)
member.remarks: Stream is initialized to be ready for uncompressed video (bottom-up BGR) with specified parameters. However, properties (such as ) can be changed later if the stream is to be fed with pre-compressed data.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.AddEncodingVideoStream(SharpAvi.Codecs.IVideoEncoder,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: Whether encoder should be disposed with the writer.

remarks.para: Stream is initialized to be to be encoded with the specified encoder. Method expects data in the same format as encoders, that is top-down BGR32 bitmap. It is passed to the encoder and the encoded result is written to the stream. Parameters isKeyFrame and length are ignored by encoding streams, as encoders determine on their own which frames are keys, and the size of input bitmaps is fixed.
Properties and are defined by the encoder, and cannot be modified.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.AddAudioStream(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.remarks: Stream is initialized to be ready for uncompressed audio (PCM) with specified parameters. However, properties (such as ) can be changed later if the stream is to be fed with pre-compressed data.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.AddEncodingAudioStream(SharpAvi.Codecs.IAudioEncoder,System.Boolean)
member.param: Whether encoder should be disposed with the writer.

remarks.para: Stream is initialized to be to be encoded with the specified encoder. Method expects data in the same format as encoder (see encoder's docs). The data is passed to the encoder and the encoded result is written to the stream.
The encoder defines the following properties of the stream: , , , , , , . These properties cannot be modified.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.Output.AviWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes the writer and AVI file itself.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStream.Index
member.summary: Serial number of this stream in AVI file.

member.name: P:SharpAvi.Output.IAviStream.Name
member.remarks: May be used by some players when displaying the list of available streams.

member.remarks: Simply delegates all operations to wrapped stream.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.FourCC.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of with a string value.
member.param: String value of FOURCC. Should be not longer than 4 characters, all of them are printable ASCII characters.
member.remarks: If the value of is shorter than 4 characters, it is right-padded with spaces.

member.summary: Returns string representation of this instance.
member.returns: String value if all bytes are printable ASCII characters. Otherwise, the hexadecimal representation of integer value.

member.summary: Gets hash code of this instance.

member.summary: Gets the string value of instance.

member.summary: Determines whether two instances of are equal.

member.name: M:SharpAvi.FourCC.op_Inequality(SharpAvi.FourCC,SharpAvi.FourCC)
member.summary: Determines whether two instances of are not equal.

member.name: F:SharpAvi.BitsPerPixel.Bpp8
